intro: Hedysarum lineare, commonly known as the linear milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia and North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring slender, often branching stems. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink or violet, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. Hedysarum lineare is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
